channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TN

item.title: Report X-2024010839
item.description:
Report X-2024010839

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-15T12:17:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-27
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: ON Jan 27th during the PM sort a package was found to be leaking a while substance. The package was marked as UN1263 Paint, 3, PGII!. It appears that the secondary containment failed when the can inside was damaged causing the lid to come off. The package was placed into a steel salvage drum and an amended shippers declaration was requested from the shipper.

item.title: Report X-2024020518
item.description:
Report X-2024020518

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-15T12:17:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-11
  • City: MURFREESBORO
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was loaded onto the overhead conveyor belt. The package was then dropped down the ADM shoot and rollers, wet and leaking. The package was then placed into a plastic and then into a red hazardous tote to mitigate any additional leakage. The tote was transferred to the HazMat station for further inspection. DescribePack: Two of the 1-gallon bottles had loose caps which resulted in a leakage. The package was semi-wet from the spilled product. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed in a plastic bag and then into a red hazardous tote to mitigate any additional spillage.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: As the trailer was being unloaded there were a lot of wet packages and the hazmat was originally put with them once QA came it was found that the hazmat was not from rain damage and was then put into a plastic bag and a black tote to be brought back to the cage for proper processing. DescribePack: loose cap DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: put inside a plastic bag and a black tote

item.title: Report X-2024020120
item.description:
Report X-2024020120

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-15T12:17:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-26
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 01/26/2024 at approximately 1235, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 5007286 at the hub facility in Memphis, reporting a spill oil shipment. The shipment consited of one fiberboard box containing 9 bottles of scented oil. It appears that closures were not secured on the bottles, resulting in complete spillage and total loss of shipment.

item.title: Report E-2024020086
item.description:
Report E-2024020086

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-12T18:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-30
  • City: ANTIOCH
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On January 30, 2024, one (!) 5-gallon drum of UN1263 was damaged in transit due to unprotected freight and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the site. HES personnel deployed granular absorbents to the sealant-impacted trailer and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents as well as the damaged pail were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum which was staged onsite for future disposal.
